alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 15 at 11:03PM AKST until December 16 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Damage to power lines is possible. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, are expected. Visibility less than one quarter mile at times. * WHERE...Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley. * WHEN...Until 4 PM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 55 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. Cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Winds will decrease Thursday afternoon and conditions will improve then. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow and blowing snow means severe winter weather conditions are occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
